description: Several Tesla vehicles were set on fire at a Las Vegas service center using Molotov cocktails. The word 'RESIST' was spray-painted on the building. Authorities are investigating it as a targeted attack.

newsLinks.title: FBI investigating Tesla vehicles shot and set on fire at facility in Las Vegas
Teslas set on fire at Las Vegas repair shop in latest incident of vandalism targeting company

description: Two Tesla Cybertrucks were found burned at a Kansas City Tesla dealership lot in a likely arson incident.

newsLinks.title: Fire burns Cybertrucks at KC Tesla dealership, police say
2 Tesla Cybertrucks burned at Kansas City dealership; KCPD, ATF, FBI investigating

description: Coordinated nationwide protests: Hundreds protested at Tesla dealerships across multiple states, with peaceful demonstrations and some minor scuffles.
Drive-by shooting (2nd incident): One week after the first attack on March 6, the Tigard Tesla store was targeted again before dawn with 10–15 shots, causing extensive damage.
Tires slashed and graffiti: Six Tesla Cybertrucks at a Dedham dealership were vandalized with slashed tires and graffiti, confirmed by local police.
Confirmed fire: A blaze destroyed four Tesla Cybertrucks parked at a Tesla lot in Seattle, with ATF investigating.
'Tesla Takedown' rally: Over 350 protesters gathered outside the Tesla showroom, occupying it and forcing a shutdown; NYPD arrested 6 people, DOJ classifying as 'domestic extremism.'
Molotov attack: A 24-year-old man threw incendiary devices at a Tesla charging station, accidentally set himself on fire, and left motive graffiti; confirmed charges by DOJ.
Series of Molotov and Nazi graffiti attacks: A suspect conducted multiple attacks on a Tesla dealership, culminating in an arson fire; suspect charged.
Needs verification
Drive-by shooting (1st incident): At ~5 AM, 7–8 gunshots were fired into a Tesla showroom in Tigard, hitting three cars and shattering windows.
Stickers on vehicles: A 39-year-old man placed stickers of Elon Musk’s face on several Teslas, calling it 'free speech.' He was charged with six counts of defacing property.

Keying incident at Dallas-Fort Worth Airport: A Tesla’s cameras recorded a man keying the car’s paint in the parking lot around 4:15 PM. The owner filed a police report and posted the video online, which went viral (even retweeted by Donald Trump Jr.). Police are investigating, and the incident highlights growing anti-Tesla sentiment.
Charging stations torched: Seven Tesla Supercharger stalls at a shopping center outside Boston were set on fire overnight.
Anti-Musk graffiti: After a protest at a Tesla dealership, police found 'No Musk' scrawled with a swastika on the building.
Demonstration at Tesla dealership with nine arrests for disorderly conduct.
Shots fired at dealership: Around 3:00 AM, an assailant fired multiple rounds into a Tesla dealership’s building and at least one vehicle.
Attempted arson: Incendiary devices targeting Tesla dealership.
Nazi spray-paint on 15 Tesla vehicles.
Molotov cocktails thrown at Tesla dealership.
Nazi spray-paint on Tesla dealership sign.

Serial graffiti attacks: A 42-year-old suspect vandalized a Tesla dealership multiple times. She spray-painted 'Nazi' under the entrance sign and on 15 vehicles. Lucy Grace Nelson was arrested in February and charged with malicious destruction of property.
Molotov cocktail attacks (series): Over five late-Jan to Feb incidents, a suspect hurled Molotov cocktails at a Tesla dealership, igniting small fires.
A Cybertruck exploded outside the Trump International.
Supercharger cables stolen: Thieves cut and stole 18 out of 19 charging cables at a Tesla Supercharger station in one night.
'Rolling Coal' road harassment: A viral TeslaCam dashcam video showed a modified diesel pickup deliberately 'coal rolling' a Tesla twice on a highway.
Charger blocking & pranks: A Dodge Ram pickup was parked in a Tesla charging spot with the Supercharger cable mockingly draped into its bed.
Charger blocking & pranks: A Dodge Ram pickup was parked in a Tesla charging spot with the Supercharger cable mockingly draped into its bed (also listed under Theft & Sabotage).
ICE-ing protest: Pickup truck owners deliberately blocked access to Tesla Supercharger stalls, shouting 'F*** Tesla!' while preventing Tesla drivers from charging.
